result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 21CM3724 and 21CM4060 with huber privileges for work.

miscConds.notes: Court set restitution at zero for all cases.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
All costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharges to be paid by the end of probation, 09/30/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.

No possession of firearms unless it is part of firearms safety course.
No contact with MJK as to case 21CM4060.

Complete anger management class.
Complete firearm safety course.

timeConds.notes: A total of 15 hours community service as to all cases

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Ray

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael M Ray in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing hearing proceeded with cases 21CM4060 and 22CM361 with statements from state, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to:
As to 21CM3724
- Serve 40 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to 21CM4060 and 22CM361 with huber privileges for work.

As to 21CM4060
- Serve 40 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to 21CM3724 and 22CM361 with huber privileges for work.

As to 21CM361
- Serve 40 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to 21CM3724 and 21CM4060 with huber privileges for work.

Court stayed the sentences and placed defendant on 15 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- maintain work and school
- complete a firearms safety course
- no possession of firearms unless it is part of firearms safety course
- a total of 15 hours community service as to all cases
- complete anger management class
- no contact with MJK as to case 21CM4060

Court set restitution at zero for all cases.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, 09/30/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Michael M Ray in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case passed for sentencing.

Defendant Michael M Ray in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Case adjourned due to Court's calendar. Case adjourned back to Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael M Ray in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested adjournment due to the lateness of the hour. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael M Ray in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael M Ray in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Dee. Branch 37.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge 37, Branch Dee.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Corey Flynn Received and filed
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/3/22 @ 1:30p
